poem:
### Inquiries and Shadows

Open minds weigh the souls of a city,  
children's voices thin as vapour trails.  
Promises and paychecks jangle,  
a government's brass coins clinking.  
Beneath the starlit dome of the Commons,  
every pupil becomes a page  
in a book still waiting to be read—  
ghosts in classrooms whispering history's pains.
